[Dave on recording] Morgan, uh, I'm calling you to tell you

And, uh, we're havin' a baby.
I mean...
when we told our parents the news,
their emotion,
it was of pure joy, right?
And...
-[interviewer] Want to show it to us? -[chuckles] Yeah.
I don't have my phone.
Ah, there it is.
[Dave] I was unprepared for the emotion.
[Sherri] Thank you. Thank you, Jesus!
[Dave] I knew it was gonna be important,
but I-- I was, like, not ready for this.
[Joe on phone] Guys, it's the happiest moment

[Joe] I'm so proud of you, son.
[Dave, tearfully] Thanks, Dad.

translation.en: -[Joe] Okay. -[Dave] Okay, Dad.
-I love you guys. -[Joe] Ah. Yeah, I so love you.

translation.en: [Dave] I knew they were gonna be happy,
but I had no idea they were gonna be that happy.

translation.en: So...
-[interviewer] Wow. That's amazing. -Yeah.
Very powerful.
So...
I mean...
just thinkin' about that, it's fucking crazy to me.
translation.zh: ‎哪怕只是想想 ‎都觉得不可思议

translation.en: [Mary Sue] The problem with being a chef and a parent

translation.zh: ‎主要问题就是 当主厨很费时间

translation.en: It's... all-consuming.
[Johnny] We really, really knew we wanted to have a kid.
We were just looking for the right timing.
With having children, it's never the right time.
translation.zh:
‎但要孩子这件事
‎从来没有时机合适一说

translation.en: Ever.
Especially as a chef,
for a long time, all you do is consider
what you're doing, what you're going through,
and the restaurant. That's the singular most important thing.
translation.zh: ‎以及餐馆 那是最重要的

translation.en: And all of a sudden, that changes.
You have something else that you're responsible for,
and it just kinda fucks with you like nothing else...
you know, will.
[Mary Sue] Once you become a parent,
for me, it was the first time that anything in my life
translation.zh: ‎对我来说 这是在我人生中第一次

translation.en: was more important than cooking.
You get told, you know, "It's either a career or a child."
translation.zh: ‎别人会说 “事业和宝宝不能兼顾”

translation.en: Like, why?
Why does it have to be a career or a child?
All right. [exhales deeply]
[chuckles] I'm so tired.
-I'm so tired. -[water runs]
So, I've been on the road too much.
So much.
[Dave] So we have nothing in the fridge other than...

for every meal.
So, it's kimchi jjigae with ground soybeans.
[Dave] It looks terrible. Look at this.
When I first started to date Grace, and Grace would be craving this dish,

translation.en: I'd be, like, "Wow...
That's gnarly."
[laughs] I mean, it's trash.
[Grace chuckles] It's really good.
[Dave] And I've been on the road so much

What's goin' on, Grace?
We have our 20-week scan.
It's a pretty big deal, you know, to come... get this far,

translation.en: and so now we're just making sure in the second trimester

translation.en: everything's going well.
[Dave] We found out pretty early on. We found out at, like, nine weeks, right?

translation.en: [interviewer] What?
-[chuckles softly] It's a boy. -Yeah. Yeah.
[Dave] This year's been so emotional.
But this is the first time we're gonna see it as a...

translation.en: see the baby as, like, a...
little humanoid.
That's really exciting.
-[Dave] So... -It's exciting.
I should brush my teeth.
-[Dave] 'Cause you have kimchi breath? -[Grace] Yeah.

‎-因为嘴里都是泡菜味吗？
‎-是啊

translation.en: [chuckles] I'm gonna do that.
First of all, I never thought that someone would want to have a kid with me,
translation.zh: ‎首先 我从没觉得谁会想给我生孩子

translation.en: number one.
Work was my everything.
I think when I met Grace, it was, like, "Oh."

translation.en: Like, "There are other things out there." [chuckles]
translation.zh: ‎我突然发现 在工作之外 还有其他事

translation.en: -[technician] Are you videoing? -[Dave] Yeah.
I can't believe you can see this.

translation.en: I do believe that Dave will end up being a better parent than...

translation.en: he thinks.
[Dave] Look how defined the spine is.
Oh, my God. Is that his heart beating?
-[technician] Yes. -[Dave] Oh, my God.
[Grace whispering] He's been so emotional.
He was crying a lot.
So much.
What would happen if you found out we're actually having a girl?

translation.en: -[Dave] I'd be so happy. -[chuckles]
[Dave] Just can't have another Chang man.
[Grace] Hello!
-[woman] Hi! -Hi!
-[Grace] Hi! -Hey!
-[woman 1] Hi, David. -Hi, Mama.
[Grace] Hi. Hi, Sammie.
[Sherri] This is a miracle to see Grace and baby.
translation.zh: ‎我能看到格蕾丝和宝宝 真是奇迹

translation.en: My history...
I've been so sick all the time.
I've been cancer for 24 years.
But, since, uh, two years ago,
I-- I'm very serious, that time.
And basically, the doctor told my mom,
like, a hospice would be... would be appropriate.
-Yeah. -So, they put her on some new stuff,
translation.zh:
‎-是啊
‎-然后他们给她用了新药

translation.en: and, you know, long story cut short,
she's healthier than she's been in probably 20-plus years.
And when we told you over the phone that Grace and I were expecting,
translation.zh:
‎我们打电话告诉她
‎我和格蕾丝要有宝宝了

translation.en: you just-- I've never seen you behave that way.
translation.zh: ‎你当时… ‎我从没见过你那么激动

translation.en: How surprised I am.
I was even crying that time.
My husband and me...
Wow, we still alive, so I can see the... another baby. [chuckles]
Yeah, that's why I'm excited today.
translation.zh: ‎是啊 所以我当时那么激动

translation.en: Grace came over, so I'm making food for Grace.

-Is it for baby? -[Sherri] Yeah.
[Grace] She's just showing me how to make this

You know what? This only the boiling water like this.
-Ah. -Just to pour in this one.
-[Grace] Ah. -[Dave] You never make this for us!

-[Dave] Oh, my God. -[Grace] Ooh!

What babies have you been feeding that to?
[Sherri] No one.
[Dave] Oh, man.
-[Sherri] That's it. -[Grace] That's it?
[Sherri] Mm-hmm. So, everybody can make this kind of food.

‎我觉得妈妈就像
‎韩国版朱莉娅·查尔德

translation.en: I'm beginning to understand that, being a parent,

...underdeveloped because of work.
-No? -[Esther] No, take a bite.
[Dave] And the restaurants, more or less, have been my kids.

translation.en: -[Sammie] I'm gonna take a bite of Mom's. -Of mine? Okay.
[Dave] It's pretty good, right?

David, I cannot wait for you to have your own kids.

‎-这是世上最美好的事情
‎-会很轻松的

‎-你没开过餐馆
‎-回头你就知道了

translation.zh:
‎-我不知道
‎-你不能跟孩子嚷嚷

‎-咄咄逼人的私语呢？
‎-也不行的

-[Esther] Oh! No! Jonathan... -[laughing]
[Esther] Don't laugh at that, David.
-That was awesome. -[Esther] You can't laugh at those things.
That's the thing.
I don't think you know what's coming yet.

translation.en: I've almost become like Peter Pan.
In some ways, I feel like I'm 120 years old.
translation.zh: ‎某种程度上 我觉得自己已经120岁了

translation.en: And there are other parts of my life
where I have no idea what the fuck is going on.

A muffin?
-Yes. -You want to cook a muffin?
Okay, first you gotta sift the flour. You need to go shh-shh-shh.

translation.en: There's, like, a... a big moment of reckoning right now,

translation.en: between old Dave Chang and...
"Dad" Dave Chang.
Expecting dad.
This is the muffin tins, okay? You gotta pour the batter in here.
translation.zh: ‎这些是玛芬蛋糕烤模 好吗？ ‎你要把面糊倒进来

translation.en: No.
Pour this...
into here.
You gotta put it into individual muffin tins,

You're not making a muffin. You're making a cake.

-[Esther] And she's gone. -[Dave] Sammie, come back here.

translation.en: This is your child,
so it's gonna be different."
I'll-- I'll keep on playing, but you gotta make a muffin the real way.

‎我可以继续陪你玩
‎但你要好好做玛芬蛋糕

translation.en: -Uh-oh. -[Dave] I'm heading into unknown territory.
And, like most things in my life, I just figure it out by fucking it up.

‎跟往常一样
‎我是在搞砸以后才发现的

translation.en: The difference is, like... [scoffs]
...fucking this up might really have serious repercussions on someone:
translation.zh:
‎搞砸这件事
‎可能会对某人产生严重影响

translation.en: my-- this child.
[Tae] Now that's good once you flip it. Yeah.

translation.en: I feel like it's, like, two or three minutes.
If it's taking that long, it's not hot enough.

translation.en: [Dave] Tae is, like, all over the place.
I'm trying to get him to be, like, less hands-on.
As weird as that sounds.
[Dave] You work like a crazy person, man.
Like, in the best possible sense.
All I know is, like, you work a lot like me...
translation.zh: ‎我只知道 你工作起来很像我…

translation.en: in the kitchen.
I'm telling you, man, like, burning the candle at both ends

translation.en: is, uh, not a healthy place to be.
Yeah, I'm trying to be smarter about how extreme my emotional investment is
translation.zh: ‎是啊 有些时候 我会试着更明智地

translation.en: in any given moment,
before the kitchen has taken its toll on you
translation.zh: ‎免得厨房以一种无法解释的方式

translation.en: in ways that you can't account for.
Could you imagine having a family now?
-In this moment? -[Dave] Yeah.
No.
There's an element there where I'm like, "Fuck, man.
translation.zh: ‎我总有一种念头 “算了 伙计

translation.en: If I was to have kids right now, how does this affect your career?"
translation.zh: ‎如果现在要孩子 那事业怎么办？”

translation.en: It's always that thing in the back of my mind.
Where it's like, "Could it derail your career?"
I mean, I definitely thought that.
How do you do what you do and then figure out time to have a family?
translation.zh: ‎如何在工作之余 ‎找出时间来组建家庭？

translation.en: Yeah, that's like the-- That's the ultimate question, right?

translation.en: ♪ Who knows where I'm gonna be I just try and be ♪

I-- I don't have that answer yet.
[Peter] This wall separates our house side from the restaurant.
-This is awesome, man. -Yeah.
It feels very much just like you're at someone's home in Korea.
translation.zh: ‎感觉就像在韩国朋友的家里一样

translation.en: It really does.
It's the feel of being in our home that I think people feel when they come here.
translation.zh:
‎人们来到这里时
‎感觉就像在家里一样

translation.en: But it also feels like New York.
[laughs] Yeah.
♪ So I just go ♪
♪ Forever yes, never no ♪
[Dave] I still find it strange, in the best possible way,
that we're in your home.
I'm like, "Peter, you got service!" [laughing] It's like 15 minutes away!
translation.zh: ‎我还会想 “彼得 得去店里了！ ‎路上还要15分钟呢！”

translation.en: -Yeah. -Are we 15 minutes out?
[sighs] All right.
I mean, what you'll find a lot is, like, you know, toys.
translation.zh: ‎我是说 你会在这里发现很多玩具

translation.en: He'll stash his toys around, and you'll find them in shelves and stuff.
translation.zh: ‎他会乱藏玩具 ‎你会在架子上发现一些

translation.en: I think I met you when you first started cookin', right?
translation.zh: ‎我们认识时 你刚开始烹饪吧？

translation.en: -[Peter] Yeah. -That was crazy.
It's funny 'cause I always looked up to you like an older brother.
translation.zh: ‎说起来有意思 我一直把你当作大哥

translation.en: But I never even caught up with you when you left New York.
translation.zh:
‎但你离开纽约后
‎我就跟你失去联系了

translation.en: I ended up leaving in quite a hurry.
My mom got sick, and we just kind of dropped everything
translation.zh: ‎我妈生病了 ‎我抛弃一切来到这里

translation.en: to, like, come out here.
And then we were just like, "You know what? We're--"
I'm-- I was done with New York by that point.
translation.zh: ‎那时我对纽约已经不感兴趣了

translation.en: I had been there 13 years.
And the way I was able to switch my mentality
was I moved to Portland.
There's no, like, New York Times star ratings.
There's no Michelin Guide.
There are none of these pressures that I felt in New York.
translation.zh: ‎这里没有我在纽约感受到的压力

translation.en: So, I can be here and just cook food that I want to cook,
translation.zh: ‎所以我可以在这里 做我想做的食物

translation.en: mainly for myself, and my friends, and my family.
translation.zh: ‎主要是为了我自己 以及亲朋好友

translation.en: -I just let go of all the sort of... -The nonsense?
translation.zh:
‎-我终于抛下了那些…
‎-没有意义的东西？

translation.en: ...all the nonsense. It is nonsense, you know?
translation.zh: ‎没有意义的东西 确实没有意义

translation.zh:
‎生孩子以后
‎让你意识到什么更重要了吗？

translation.en: I mean, I think that sounds stupid, but--
translation.zh: ‎我是说 虽然听上去有点蠢 但是…

translation.en: -[Elliott] Daddy? -Yeah?
[Elliott] Uncle Dave just said "stupid."
-[gasps playfully] -[Dave] Yeah, I said I'm stupid.
-[Peter] Oh! -I'm sorry.
-I apologize. -[Peter] There's a very strict rule of...
translation.zh: ‎抱歉 我很抱歉 ‎说话的时候 必须斟字酌句

translation.en: of alternative words you can use. [chuckles]
translation.zh: ‎说话的时候 必须斟字酌句

translation.en: [Dave] Hey, Elliott. I'm sorry.
-I have a potty mouth. -[Peter] Uh-oh.
[Dave] I see what you've done here, and it's, like, wow.
translation.zh: ‎我看到这里写的了 简直无敌了

translation.en: The hominess of it all suppresses how insane it actually is. [chuckles]
translation.zh: ‎看上去没什么 但其实挺厉害的

translation.en: To live and work in the same roof is crazy.
translation.zh:
‎在同一个屋檐下生活和工作
‎这是很疯狂的

translation.en: [Peter] Yeah. But it works for us.
translation.zh: ‎但对我们来说 这是行得通的

translation.en: A lot of people come here
and they're like, "How do separate work and life?"
translation.zh: ‎会说“你怎么区别工作和生活？”

translation.en: And we're like, "I don't see how you can't."
translation.zh: ‎我们会说“我没觉得不能区分呀”

translation.en: I don't see how you can be like, "All right. Bye, Elliott.
translation.zh: ‎我觉得我没法说 “拜拜 艾略特

translation.en: I'll see you in 14 hours."
[chuckles] Which is what many of our peers wind up doing.
translation.zh: ‎我们很多同行最终都是这样的

translation.en: Yeah.
We thought, "Okay, This could be the dining room. You know?
We can raise our family in the rooms on the side.
translation.zh: ‎我们可以住在侧面的房间里

translation.en: We can build a little wall."
But people walked into my bedroom, thinking it's the bathroom.
translation.zh:
‎但有些人会走进我们卧室
‎以为那是厕所

translation.en: And so many times that happened while I was nursing Elliott.
translation.zh: ‎我在喂艾略特时 发生过很多次

translation.en: I didn't need it to be that close,
but, you know, it's worth it for all the family time we get to have.
translation.zh: ‎但我们能有很多家庭时光 这就值了

translation.en: So, this is as traditional as our meal gets, right?
Because it's all the banchan.
And then we kind of do this as, like, the ssam... like, the ssam course.
So we have just some grilled hanger steak with the lettuces.
This is our bossam with the rice paper.
-[Dave] This is great, man. -[Sun] That's basically the menu.
translation.zh: ‎太棒了 伙计 ‎主要就是菜单

translation.en: He just makes whatever we miss about New York,
translation.zh: ‎他做的菜肴 寄托了对纽约的怀念

translation.en: the things we like about LA. He just riffs off of it.
translation.zh: ‎对洛杉矶的喜爱 ‎他会即兴做一些菜

translation.en: How do you find time to cook for your kids
when you have all this food?
For a little while,
Elliott wouldn't eat the food from the restaurant
It was just, you know, it wasn't simple enough for him.
translation.zh: ‎因为对他来说 这些食物不够简单

translation.en: It was really hard on Peter.
Do you know what it's like for a chef
whose kids won't eat your food? [chuckles]
translation.zh: ‎作为主厨 儿子不吃自己做的东西

translation.en: Cheers.
-May God bless you with a good eater. -[Dave laughs]
When you're a chef and you have a new child,
translation.zh: ‎作为主厨 我当爸爸以后

translation.en: and you think, "I'm buying all this food that's just puréed,"
translation.zh: ‎我会想 “我就买那些蔬菜泥吧”

translation.en: and "Why are the green beans this army-green color?
translation.zh:
‎然后会想
‎“青豆泥怎么都是橄榄绿色？

translation.en: I can make them green." So I did.
translation.zh: ‎我能做成青绿的” 于是我就自己做了

translation.en: But it was helpful to have some extra hands.
translation.zh: ‎但如果能有帮手 那就太好了

translation.en: At WD50, we used to get people that would come
translation.zh: ‎在WD50 我们过去会招聘想来的人

translation.en: and they'd want to work at the restaurant just to gain experience.
translation.zh: ‎他们来餐厅工作 就是为了获得经验

translation.en: I would make a really nice carrot puree,
or a bright-green zucchini puree,
and I would say, "I want you to pass this twice
through a really fine sieve,
put it in these beautiful silicone molds,
and freeze them.
When they're frozen, take them out
arrange them in these zip-lock bags, and bring them back to me."
translation.zh: ‎放到有拉链的袋子里 ‎再拿给我看”

translation.en: "Yes, Chef." No questions asked.
translation.zh: ‎“好的 主厨” 不要质疑 照做就行

translation.en: So, I would have people that would travel
from all over the world to come work at the restaurant.
translation.zh: ‎一般都是来自世界各地的人

translation.en: And they didn't know it, but they were actually making baby food.
translation.zh:
‎但他们并不知道
‎其实他们在给孩子做饭

translation.en: It takes a village.

Delicious. If I were a baby or an adult, I would eat this.

-You want to keep your baby trim, right? -[both chuckle]

Yeah.
But look at this color. It's gorgeous.
Yeah, but no baby's gonna be, like, "Yeah! Gimme some more of that!"

‎是啊 但宝宝不会说

translation.en: -"Baby Chang's." -[both laugh]
Come on! How could you not start something called "Baby Chang's"?

-That you just stole? -[Dave] Yeah.
-We stole a baby. He's sitting out there. -[Nick] On the street? Great.

‎-我的天啊
‎-看来这位顾客饿得不行了

if he's eating the table.
-Oh, nice job. -[Dave] What do you think?
I'm gonna get a bad Yelp review. [Nick] Hey, man, you got something on your face.

‎-我要收到一条差评了

‎我们只需要汤姆塞立克
‎和史蒂夫加顿伯格 就稳了

‎-他很喜欢
‎-你最好把桌子做成菜

[Nick] I'm surprised by how much food is already all over him.

translation.en: -[Dave] It's food on you, too! -Yeah, he just put his food on me.

‎看起来像蜂蜜芥末

[Nick] You want these peas?
[Dave] Oh, my God!
Can you believe neither of us have had a child yet?
translation.zh: ‎我俩其实都没孩子 你能相信吗？

translation.en: Slip-sloppin' right out of his mouth.
Do you wish more people at your restaurants
did that as they ate?
-Are you taking a dump? Yeah! -[coos]
Oh, I can't wait to see this come out
in the rainbow of colors.
Your doodie's gonna look like an LGBTQ flag.

translation.en: I'm gonna feed more of these peas that this baby doesn't like.

translation.en: with, like, a tiny version of you, soon?

translation.en: I don't even understand it.
This week on Ugly Delicious...
tables and napkins,
the most delicious thing in a baby's mouth.
[Paul] Feeding children... you figure out what they like,

translation.en: and you make whatever that is
the most delicious and the most nutritious it could be.
translation.zh: ‎你都要做到最好吃 最有营养

translation.en: [Tom] I try to just have them eat what we're eating
translation.zh: ‎我试着让他们吃我们吃的东西

translation.en: and sometimes it's a struggle.
If I decide to pick a fight with him and try to force him to eat,
I'm gonna lose this battle.
We're better off just putting the food down,
and if he says, "I don't wanna eat this," we ignore it.
translation.zh: ‎如果他说“我不想吃” 我们就无视他

translation.en: And, eventually, he'll eat it.
[Helen] She loves pizza.
She saves the crusts and calls them "pizza bones."
translation.zh: ‎她不吃硬边 说那是“披萨骨头”

translation.en: And she'll eat those later.
[Edouardo] I spend a lot of time thinking about the foods
that I cook at the restaurant
And even our kids menu
is driven on the foods that I would actually cook for my son.

translation.en: [Floyd] My boys love food.
So, it's very exciting for me to eat with them, cook with them,
translation.zh:
‎所以我很愿意
‎跟他们一起吃 一起做饭

translation.en: introduce them to cool stuff.
I think that's the best gift I could've given them.
translation.zh: ‎我觉得这是我能给他们的最佳礼物

translation.en: [Paul] But kids are tricky.
You gotta treat each one like they're their own person.
You just can't, you know, put everybody in a box.
[Dave] I feel like foods for kids, in general,
has to get better.
I mean, what we feed people in schools
translation.zh: ‎我是说 我们在学校提供的食物

translation.en: is garbage. [chuckles]
It's like, the people that need to be fed the best
are fed the worst.
And I know there are people that are actively working their asses off

translation.en: to make that change.
The most talented and knowledgeable people that are in the food world
translation.zh: ‎在餐饮界最有才华和知识的人

translation.en: are catering to such a small percentage of people
And there's all these other people out there that need to eat,
but no thought is going into that.
[Dave] I met Dan when he was at Noma.
He was the head chef of the number one restaurant in the world.
[Dave] You knew that you needed to make a change.
translation.zh:
‎-你知道你需要做出改变
‎-是啊

translation.en: -Right. -And you hatched this idea
translation.zh:
‎-你知道你需要做出改变
‎-是啊 ‎你想出了在学校食堂工作的主意

translation.en: of you working in school kitchens.
translation.zh: ‎你想出了在学校食堂工作的主意

translation.en: [Dan] Yeah.
translation.zh:
‎（丹·朱斯蒂想要改变
‎孩子们的饮食方式）

translation.en: The point of it is to get professionally trained chefs

[Dan] And you have third graders here today, Dave.

translation.en: These are dictated by the USDA.
So, you have oil, there's butter.
You see? That is how much butter you can use for four meals.

translation.en: -It's not a lot. -Do you ever just, like, sneak more in?

‎-并不多
‎-你有没有偷偷多加过？

‎-没有 不行的
‎-我也许会哦

translation.en: So, we have about $1.25 to come up with a lunch

translation.en: that feeds kids.

-[Dave] Not that much, right? -[Dan] Stop. We can't afford that much.

‎-不能多加 对吧？
‎-停吧 要控制成本

translation.en: That's probably like 30% of your food cost right there.
That's not enough.
Damn it!

‎-我可以尽可能多用蔬菜吗？
‎-可以

when it comes to the kids.
And that's the hardest part.
You go through all this trouble, you come up with a meal,

translation.en: and then a student who legitimately is starving
and hasn't eaten since lunch yesterday,

translation.en: chooses not to eat your meal
because it's not appetizing to them at all.
[Dave] This is hard, bro.
[Dave] I remember you telling me that "I'm gonna approach this
translation.zh:
‎我记得你告诉我
‎“我要用以前解决问题的方式

translation.en: the same way that I'd approach anything else in my life.
That's right.
-"And I want to make a difference." -That's right.
I think they'll like that.
[Dan] I just love this right now. You're just, like, sweating.
translation.zh: ‎我喜欢你现在满头大汗的样子

translation.en: You're not even plating on a level surface.
-What, you just abandon any kind of... -[Dave] Yeah.
translation.zh:
‎-怎么 你打算抛弃各种…
‎-是啊

translation.en: -Just plate up here. -I learned by watching you!

‎-就是盛在上面
‎-我是跟你学的

-I think it looks very good. -[Dave] I think it looks good!

‎-我觉得看着很好吃 锡镐
‎-我也觉得！

translation.en: [laughs] I want to eat this.

[Dan] Go for it, you guys. Get into it.
[boy 1] It's actually kind of good.

[boy 2] The chicken is awesome.
-[Dave] What do you think, sir? -[Dan] Do not rush him, okay?

‎-你觉得呢？
‎-不要催他 好吗？

translation.en: -Yes! -They're happy with the rice, man.

‎-太好了！
‎-他们觉得米饭很好吃

translation.en: You've done well.
You've done well, bro. -Thank you. -[chuckles]
[Dave] They're really putting away the food, man.
[Dan] They are. They like it. I will say, the work is really hard,

translation.en: but when you see, especially the little kids,

translation.en: -It's amazing. -You gotta feel good about that.
I know, right? That's the stuff, man.

translation.zh: ‎跟我说说 你现在是什么感觉？

translation.en: [exhales] I just want to eat something again.
[sighs] First trimester is really hard.
First trimester, I was miserable.

translation.en: Any kind of food I would look at, I just couldn't.

translation.en: [Dave] How was your nausea yesterday?
-Horrible. -[Dave] Horrible?
Hormones are gonna peak...
soon.
It's so hard.
I would have moments of random cravings.

translation.zh: ‎她最早想吃的 是芝士通心粉

translation.en: I ran to the supermarket, bought everything.
[Grace] He made a beautiful pot of macaroni and cheese.
translation.zh: ‎他给我做了一锅芝士通心粉

translation.en: [Dave] And then I brought it to her, and she was, like, "No."
translation.zh: ‎然后我送到她面前 她说“不想吃”

translation.en: -[laughs] -[Grace] I did not want that.
I told him, specifically, "From the box." I didn't even touch the one he made.
translation.zh: ‎我跟他说 “我要吃快餐那种” ‎我都没有碰他做的

translation.en: I knew how sad he was.
But he can't say anything. He's like, "Okay.
translation.zh: ‎但他不能说什么 只能说“好吧

translation.en: I'll make you Kraft Macaroni & Cheese.
translation.zh: ‎我给你做卡夫的芝士通心粉”

translation.en: -I kept telling myself, -[Dave sighs]
"It's all worth it."
I texted Dave one day,
and I told him, "The first meal I want once this baby's out is sushi."
translation.zh:
‎告诉他“等孩子生出来
‎我第一顿饭要吃寿司”

translation.en: Good sushi, if we can. [chuckles]
translation.zh: ‎如果可以 找一家好吃的寿司店

translation.en: This is amazing.
-I don't think I've ever seen -A whole... A whole tuna. [chuckles]
translation.zh:
‎-我从没见过一整只…
‎-一整只金枪鱼

translation.en: [Emily] So, how pregnant are you?
[Grace] So, right now, we're...
-21 weeks, -[Emily] Uh-huh. and I'm craving everything.
translation.zh: ‎已经21周了 我现在什么都想吃

translation.en: It's... [chuckles]
Obviously, sushi's one of them.
But it's been tough because there's a lot of foods that I love eating.
translation.zh: ‎但是太难了 因为我喜欢的很多食物

translation.en: Like, oysters and an occasional glass of wine,
translation.zh: ‎比如生蚝 比如偶尔小酌一杯

translation.en: -that I haven't been able to indulge. -Yeah.
You know, your book sheds light on something that so many women have questions about.
translation.zh: ‎你的书解释了很多孕妈的疑问

translation.en: [Emily] Yeah, I mean, they give you this list:
hot dogs, and sushi, and oysters,
and it's just so hard to figure out which things were, like, important.
translation.zh: ‎搞清楚哪些事情是重要的 是很难的

translation.en: I got very frustrated. And I'm an economist. Like, I'm a data person,
translation.zh: ‎我很沮丧 我是学经济的 研究数据

translation.en: and so I ended up just, like, trying to basically use research
to sort of figure out not only, like, are these things right,
translation.zh: ‎来弄清楚 哪些东西是正确的

translation.en: -but also why. -Right.
Like, why am I not supposed to have turkey?
And, like, many of those restrictions,
there's nothing special about being pregnant.
-Mm. -Like, if you eat bad sushi
translation.zh: ‎比如 如果你吃了坏的寿司

translation.en: or a bad oyster, like, you can get sick.
translation.zh: ‎或者坏的生蚝 你就会生病

translation.en: -No matter what? -[Emily] No matter what.
And it doesn't pass to the baby.
Like, there's not anything sort of pregnancy-specific
-about the fact that it's bad. -Huh. That's interesting.
translation.zh:
‎-并不是针对孕妇说的
‎-有意思

translation.en: [Grace] Was your doctor more,
"It's okay to have a glass of wine once in a while," or was--
translation.zh: ‎“偶尔喝一两杯酒也可以” 还是…

translation.en: [Emily] So, my doctor, she said, "Don't have a lot,
If you want to, like, occasionally have a glass of wine, it's... it's, like, totally fine."
translation.zh: ‎如果偶尔小酌 也是肯定没事的

translation.en: I think that she had a reaction I think a lot of people have,
translation.zh: ‎我想很多人都会有她那样的反应

translation.en: which was, like, "Sure, we don't really know."
what's the... what's the downside to avoiding it?
translation.zh:
‎-但是少喝酒又有什么不好呢？
‎-是哦

translation.en: -Right. -And I think that was the thing
translation.zh:
‎-但是少喝酒又有什么不好呢？
‎-是哦 ‎我觉得这是最让我沮丧的事情

translation.en: I found most frustrating.
translation.zh: ‎我觉得这是最让我沮丧的事情

translation.en: Why isn't the fact that I would like to have this
translation.zh: ‎为什么不是我想喝就能喝呢？

translation.en: something that is valued?
[Grace] Right! And so, at what point
do you actually just take it as,
"It's okay to have a glass of wine once in a while and have sushi."
translation.zh: ‎“偶尔小酌 吃吃寿司 也是可以的”

translation.en: [Emily] All fish are okay to have occasionally.
translation.zh: ‎所有的鱼 偶尔吃都可以

translation.en: [server] This is a charcoal-seared pike mackerel
with deep-fried ginkgo nuts.
-[Grace] This looks amazing. -[Emily] This really looks amazing.
And your daughter's fine.
I have two kids. They're totally fine.
translation.zh: ‎我有俩孩子 都健健康康的

translation.en: I'm so-- [chuckles] I'm so happy I'm here with you right now.
translation.zh: ‎我很高兴今天出来跟你聊天

translation.en: As women, chefs are ready.
translation.zh: ‎作为女性主厨 我们时刻准备着

translation.en: We're, like, expected to be the caretakers of everyone.
But having to juggle that
when, you know, your employees, everyone needs something from you,
translation.zh: ‎当所有员工都找你有事的时候

translation.en: your tickets are racking up...
-MLM to go. ...the baby is crying, like...
You know, it's a lot that you have to balance.
translation.zh: ‎你懂的 这时就需要权衡很多了

translation.en: [Fanny] I have an almost-nine-month-old baby.
I'm still nursing him, which is really difficult,
translation.zh: ‎我还在照顾他 真的很难

translation.en: finding time while I'm at work
to, you know, to get milk for him.
It's a powerful and beautiful thing to be a woman.
translation.zh: ‎做女人是一件强大而美丽的事情

translation.en: It's really amazing to see
the many different women who are able to...
go through this and...
raise children and do their best.
[Dave] So, this is miyeok-guk.
It's traditionally beef broth,
but my mom would make it with just myulchi broth,
which is just anchovy--
No, miyeok-guk is no myulchi.
translation.zh: ‎不是的 海带汤不用凤尾鱼

translation.en: [Dave] You made it with myulchi -all the time! -No. no, no.
Oh, my gosh. She's lying through her teeth.
-Why is miyeok-guk important? -[Sherri] A lot of iron.
translation.zh: ‎为什么海带汤这么重要？ ‎富含铁元素

translation.en: -[Grace] A lot of iron? -[Sherri] And a lot of minerals.
translation.zh:
‎-富含铁元素？
‎-还有很多矿物质

translation.en: -[Grace] A lot of minerals. -Especially for the pregnant woman.
-[Grace] Pregnant woman. -For baby.
[Grace] And it helps clean the blood after she's given birth.
translation.zh: ‎在生产以后 可以帮助净化血液

translation.en: [Dave] You have to eat it for 30 days, right?
-[Kathy] More than that. -[Sherri] More than 30 days.
So I have to make this for, what? Like, 90 days for Grace?
translation.zh:
‎所以我要连续90天
‎给格蕾丝做这道菜吗？

translation.en: -[Grace] My mom's gonna make it. -[Dave sighs in relief]
[Dave] Esther, how much miyeok-guk did you eat?
translation.zh: ‎埃斯特 你吃了多久的海带汤？

translation.en: [Esther] I ate it for three days, and I couldn't take it anymore.
translation.zh: ‎我吃了三天 就再也吃不下去了

translation.en: And then I... pretended to eat it for a month.
Mom doesn't know that.
That's a symbolism of your defiance to your parents, Esther.
translation.zh: ‎这是你反抗父母的证据 埃斯特

translation.en: [in Korean] Are there foods that pregnant women should or shouldn't eat?
translation.zh: ‎什么东西是孕妇能吃的和不能吃的？

translation.en: [in English] Something round.
Not square ones.
Peoples, you know, character--
Square character is no good,
-so everything is round. -[Dave] What are you-- What?
[Dave] "Square food, no good"?
[in Korean] No, what I mean is that bad shapes are not good.
translation.zh: ‎不是啦 我是说形状不好的 不适宜吃

translation.en: [Grace in English] She was saying that only round--
[Dave] Yeah, she said, "round food, not square food."
translation.zh: ‎是啊 她说“只能圆 别吃方”

translation.en: -I'm just trying to get a clarification. -[laughing]
It's almost like a spelling bee. Could I get it in a sentence, please?
translation.zh:
‎就像拼字比赛一样
‎能不能说一句完整的话？

translation.en: What's "square food"?
[in Korean] How do I put it?
Square foods are foods that don't make you comfortable.
translation.zh: ‎方形食物就是让你不舒服的食物

translation.en: [Dave in English] She's not talking about the geometry of food.
translation.zh: ‎她说的不是食物的几何结构

translation.en: She's talking about a certain kind of--
[Grace] The properties of a food.
[Grace in Korean] Mom, did you feed your babies with formula?
translation.zh:
‎婆婆 你和我妈妈生孩子的时候
‎都喂了配方奶吗？

translation.en: In our days, almost everyone fed their babies with formula.
translation.zh:
‎在我们那个年代
‎几乎所有人都用配方奶喂宝宝

translation.en: -[in English] But now, for me... -Uh-huh?
[in Korean] You're going to breastfeed, right?
It's good that you guys are going to do that.
translation.zh: ‎你们要这么做 还是挺好的

translation.en: [Grace in English] Yeah.
So, everyone has a different take on how they make miyeok-guk.
translation.zh: ‎所以每个人做海带汤的手法都不一样

translation.en: My mom would add soy sauce, but Dave's mom adds fish sauce.
translation.zh: ‎我妈会加酱油 锡镐的妈妈用鱼露

translation.en: -[Dave] Right now? -Yeah. Just-- Yeah, the salt.
[Dave] This is fascinating.
A very different approach. It's like two different kung fu styles.
translation.zh:
‎两种不同方法
‎就像两种不同的武功门派

translation.en: [Grace] It is.
So, another thing is,
this actually carries over into anyone's birthday.
translation.zh: ‎这道菜也会在过生日的时候吃

translation.en: [Dave] You eat this every day on your birthday to celebrate your mom.
translation.zh: ‎过生日要吃这道菜来感恩妈妈

translation.en: So...
whenever it's my birthday and my mom's not around,
translation.zh: ‎我过生日时 如果我妈不在身边

translation.en: she'll call and say, "Did you eat your miyeok-guk?"
translation.zh: ‎她就会打电话说“你喝海带汤了吗？”

translation.en: [Sherri] They're gonna be good parents.
Especially Grace.
Let's be honest. You like Grace more than me anyway now.
translation.zh:
‎说实话吧 你更喜欢格蕾丝
‎已经超过喜欢我了

translation.en: -[laughs] -Thank you, Lord, we have a nice daughter-in-law in my family.
translation.zh: ‎谢谢上帝 我们家儿媳妇那么贤惠

translation.en: That's the way. Mm.
-Is this me? -[Sherri] Yeah.
I've never seen these photos.
Oh, my God.
Look at your hanbok. Where's that?
translation.zh: ‎你快看你的韩服 这是在哪拍的？

translation.en: [Sherri] That's somebody's wedding.
-[Dave] Mom, you look great! -Hmm?
-Oh, I was great! -[both laugh]
[Dave] I have a picture of me being a bad parent.
translation.zh: ‎我想过自己不是一个称职的父亲

translation.en: I have a picture of me not being able to be present.
Me, being on planes.
The alternative is...
I just want to make bento boxes for their school lunches.
translation.zh:
‎我只想为他们做便当
‎带去学校当作午饭

translation.en: That would give me a lot of pleasure.
[teacher in Japanese] Okay, it's time for preparing lunch.
translation.zh: ‎（东京） ‎好了 该准备午餐了 先洗手吧

translation.en: Wash your hands.
translation.zh: ‎好了 该准备午餐了 先洗手吧

translation.en: [Dave in English] I've heard that, particularly in Japan,
the elementary school kids eat extraordinarily well.
And that they'd always served each other.
All these, like, Confucian elements
of service to each other, responsibility, accountability.
translation.zh: ‎为互相服务 对彼此负责

translation.en: [in Japanese] Group two, go ahead.
[Dave in English] Rito is organizing...
everyone.
Does that change every day?
[Mori, in Japanese] Yes, a different student serves school lunch every day.
translation.zh:
‎是啊 每天都会换不同学生
‎组织大家吃午餐

translation.en: [in English] He's just organizing...
He's the traffic controller.
[Rito] Yeah.
[Dave] This is amazing.
[Mori, in Japanese] Our menu always consists of some carbs like rice,
translation.zh:
‎我们的菜单总是包括一些碳水化合物
‎比如米饭

translation.en: with plenty of servings of veggies.
Just like today's soup.
And just like today's sukiyaki, which also has a lot of vegetables.
translation.zh: ‎包括今天的寿喜烧 也有很多蔬菜

translation.en: On top of that, I add some fruit for vitamin C
translation.zh: ‎最重要的是 还有水果来补充维生素C

translation.en: to make it balanced.
[both] ♪ Thanks for the food ♪
[classmates] Thanks for the food!
[Mori] We let them decide how much they can eat that day,
translation.zh: ‎我们让他们自己决定 那天能吃多少

translation.en: and control portions before eating.
Some ask for more, some ask for less.
translation.zh: ‎有人要多一点 有人要少一点

translation.en: We encourage them to not waste anything on their plate.
translation.zh: ‎我们鼓励他们不要剩菜剩饭

translation.en: [Dave in English] They have to try to eat it all.
[Mori, in Japanese] They are practicing how to use chopsticks and how to hold a bowl.
translation.zh:
‎他们正在练习如何使用筷子
‎以及如何拿碗

translation.en: [in Japanese] Lunch starts with eat-only time.
It is for kids to just enjoy and focus on eating.
translation.zh:
‎这段时间
‎孩子们就是享受和专注吃饭

translation.en: The kids are not allowed to talk.
[in English] What about, like, fats and sodium?
[in Japanese] There are recommended amounts,
so I'll try to keep it within the allowable range.
translation.zh: ‎所以我们会努力保持在允许的范围

translation.en: [in English] So, would a normal person say this is not salty enough?
translation.zh: ‎那么正常人会觉得不够咸吗？

translation.en: [Mori, in Japanese] Adults say this meal is delicious, too.
translation.zh: ‎成人也会觉得这些饭菜很好吃

translation.en: I make it flavorful using soup stock, which is traditional in Japan.
translation.zh: ‎我用了日本传统的汤料 使它很美味

translation.en: The stock makes it flavorful without too much salt.
translation.zh: ‎高汤不用加太多盐 味道就很好

translation.en: [Dave in English] Can I taste the food?
Yeah.
-[girl] Hello! -Hello.
[Mori, in Japanese] Eat-only time has finished,
so everyone can now talk and enjoy the rest of the meal.
translation.zh: ‎现在大家可以说话了 把剩下的吃完

translation.en: -[in English] That's really good. -[Mori] Yeah?
Thank you.
[Emily] No, this is extremely good.
Even for someone who's allowed to have sushi at all times.
translation.zh:
‎即使可以成天吃寿司的人
‎也会喜欢的

translation.en: -[Grace laughs] -I am not allowed to have sushi this good.
[Grace] This is amazing.
[server] This is a charcoal-grilled Japanese freshwater eel
presented with wasabi and Sansho pepper.
[Emily] Thank you.
You almost feel like you have to go through this pregnancy
translation.zh: ‎我总觉得 只能独自走过整个孕期

translation.en: alone and in hiding.
And you have to be careful that
you follow all these rules and restrictions
-because, otherwise-- -People are gonna judge you.
Judge me. Yeah.
-They'll say you don't like your baby. -Mm-hmm.
[Emily] I think the other thing was people feel like they can tell you things.
translation.zh:
‎我觉得另一件事是
‎别人都觉得自己可以指手画脚

translation.en: Just, like, people on the street. One time, I was buying coffee,
translation.zh: ‎哪怕是路人 ‎有一次我去买咖啡

translation.en: and some lady was like, "I hope that's decaf."
translation.zh: ‎一个女士说 “希望那是无咖啡因的”

translation.en: I should've been like, "It's not, actually, no.
And I'm putting an extra shot in."
You wouldn't go up to someone who's overweight and be like,
translation.zh: ‎但不会有人走到一个超重的人面前说

translation.en: -"I hope that that's a salad you're--" -Right.
Why is it okay to comment...
-[Grace] On a pregnant woman. -...on that?
[Emily] I don't think there are a lot of other experiences
where people feel that they can judge you like that.
translation.zh: ‎人们就不会这样随便地品头论足

translation.en: [Grace] Right.
Pregnancy, although it's an amazing experience,
can also be a very lonely experience.
I mean, first of all, there was a year and a half of trying.
translation.zh: ‎首先 已经有了一年半的备孕

translation.en: -Yeah. -And so, there was already that pressure
of trying to conceive.
And then, once you do conceive,
again, that process might be lonely, too, because you can't really tell people
translation.zh: ‎过程也会十分孤单 ‎因为在前三个月里

translation.en: you know, if you're pregnant or not in that first three months.
translation.zh: ‎你不能告诉别人自己怀孕的事

translation.en: And that was really difficult for me.
I think that's terrible.
I had a close friend who had a miscarriage.
translation.zh: ‎我有些闺蜜 她们流产了

translation.en: She told me early on.
And she said, "I'm so glad that I told people
translation.zh: ‎她说 “我很高兴我告诉别人了

translation.en: because this is such, like, an isolating experience.
translation.zh: ‎因为这是一个特别寂寞的过程”

translation.en: It's hard, right? Because I think most mothers
translation.zh:
‎这很艰难 是吧？
‎因为我觉得大部分母亲

translation.en: definitely bond over the fact that it's something we all share.
translation.zh: ‎都很能互相理解 ‎因为我们都经历过这个过程

translation.en: And that husbands won't really understand...
-[Emily] Yeah. Yeah. -...at all. [chuckles]
[Dave] I was...
really worried that it probably wouldn't happen.
And I was coming to terms with, like, "We're probably looking at adoption."
translation.zh:
‎我都想过跟她说
‎“我们可以考虑去收养”

translation.en: I wasn't ready for the day that it happened,
translation.zh: ‎我都没有准备好那一天的到来

translation.en: and I know when it happened.
It was the day after Tony Bourdain died.
translation.zh: ‎那是托尼·鲍登死后的第二天

translation.en: [scoffs] Yeah. It's fucking crazy.
[interviewer] Why? Why did you know that?
[Dave] Because we went to the clinic.
And I was, like, sobbing.
You know?
So...
much like I am now.
And that was the last place I wanted to be.
I just--
It's the last... last thing I wanted to do at that time,
was try to bring life into this world.
So...
when we found out, like, two weeks later,
translation.zh: ‎两周以后 我们知道以后

translation.en: I was like, "That's not fucking possible. That's not fucking possible."
translation.zh: ‎我就觉得 这不可能吧 ‎这怎么可能呢

translation.en: [Grace] That's when Dave just lost it,
and he couldn't... process,
like, how life and death can pass each other by so closely.
[Paul] I was at Momofuku
when my daughter was born.
And I left work and got fucking wasted with my best friend.
translation.zh: ‎我请假出来 跟好哥们喝到烂醉

translation.en: And I was like, "I am fucked."
Being a chef, there wasn't really talk about life/work balance.
translation.zh:
‎作为主厨
‎根本谈不上生活和工作的平衡

translation.en: It was just work.
I can look back and say I was a real shit or something,
translation.zh: ‎回首往事 我觉得我做得很差

translation.en: but for me it was like, "I'm singularly focused on this.
translation.zh: ‎但对我来说 “我特别专注于这件事

translation.en: Yes, I love my-- my-- my son, and I want to spend time with him,
translation.zh: ‎是的 我爱我的儿子 我想跟他在一起

translation.en: but, you know, I have a job to do."
[Floyd] I never had time to see what my boys were doing.
translation.zh: ‎我从来没有时间关注我的孩子

translation.en: One day a week, I had to do a double. So on Mondays, I did a double.
translation.zh:
‎每周有一天 我要工作双倍时间
‎所以我选在了周一

translation.en: I would go in in the morning, and come back when he was sleeping.
translation.zh: ‎我要早晨去上班 下班时他都睡着了

translation.en: So Tuesday evenings, when I did come in,
translation.zh: ‎所以周二晚上 我回家的时候

translation.en: he would totally ignore me
as if I didn't exist.
And that was his way of telling me, like, "Where the fuck were you?"
translation.zh: ‎他用这种方式在说 “你去哪里了？”

translation.en: [Grace] When Dave and I first met,
and just even throughout our first year of marriage,
at that point in his career,
he had already entrusted a lot of the head chefs at his restaurant,
so he wasn't in the restaurant hours.
translation.zh: ‎所以他不用在营业时间去餐厅

translation.en: Come Majordomo,
that's when I realized, "Okay...
this is what people talk about
when they talk about chefs working crazy restaurant hours
translation.zh: ‎主厨在餐厅营业时间忙得团团转

translation.en: and having a hard time being home."
[Dave] I'm a control freak at work.
translation.zh: ‎在工作中 我是一个控制狂

translation.en: Anywhere I have difficulties in life is when I try to...
translation.zh: ‎当我在生活中遇到困难的时候

translation.en: -attack life like work. -Yeah.
translation.zh:
‎-我就会像对待工作一样处理
‎-是啊

translation.en: Not a surprise, it doesn't work.
I see how my work life can spill out negatively with Grace,
translation.zh:
‎我知道我的工作
‎对格蕾丝有很多负面影响

translation.en: and I was stressing her out.
And all of a sudden, she just falls on the floor
translation.zh: ‎突然之间 她就倒在了地板上

translation.en: in so much agony and pain.
We went to the hospital and nothing happened, but...
translation.zh: ‎然后我们就去了医院 ‎没有什么大碍

translation.en: it was a terrifying experience for her, for me.
translation.zh: ‎但对她来说 对我来说 ‎都是很可怕的经历

translation.en: I feel so bad for being such a jerk to somebody in a relationship.
translation.zh: ‎我对她那么不好 ‎我感到很内疚

translation.en: -Yeah. -I was so ill-equipped,
translation.zh: ‎是啊 ‎怪我做得不够 我特别怕听她说

translation.en: and it hurts me when she's always, like,
translation.zh: ‎怪我做得不够 我特别怕听她说

translation.en: "I know that work is, like, essentially your first love."
Right? Like, for her to even, like, utter those words,
-is always like, "Oh, God." -[Sun] Yeah.
It's crazy, but when you hold your baby in your arms for the first time...
translation.zh:
‎这事说来不可思议
‎但当你第一次抱着孩子时…

translation.en: Oh, my God.
The feeling like you've awakened
and it's the first day of the rest of your life.
And all the decisions you make in the business
are gonna be related to this child,
because your one main question is going to be,
"How is this gonna affect my child?"
translation.zh: ‎“这会对我的孩子产生什么影响？”

translation.en: I went in, one person, into the hospital.
And I came out not knowing who I was any more.
translation.zh: ‎出院时 我已经不知道自己是谁了

translation.en: All of a sudden, my life goal has changed
translation.zh: ‎突然之间 我都人生目标就变了

translation.en: to keeping this baby alive.
And, you know, I don't want to do the things that I wanted to before.
translation.zh: ‎以前想做的事 现在都不想做了

translation.en: I don't have the same friends as I did before.
You know, my personality changes.
Are you okay with this change? Or are you nostalgic for the past?
translation.zh: ‎你能适应这些变化吗？ ‎还是你更你怀念以前的生活？

translation.en: I'm nostalgic for the past. But at the same time,
translation.zh:
‎我很怀念过去 ‎但与此同时
‎我也不会把其他事情摆在孩子之前

translation.en: I would never give up my kids for anything.
translation.zh:
‎但与此同时
‎我也不会把其他事情摆在孩子之前

translation.en: God, you love them so much. You know?
It's overwhelming and it's exhausting,
but there is nothing in this world that has ever mattered before and...
translation.zh: ‎但世上没有比孩子更重要的事了

translation.en: and they do make you better people.
All right, what are we doing?
[Grace] We're gonna go through all the baby stuff.
translation.zh: ‎我们要整理一下宝宝的东西

translation.en: You've never seen these outfits.
[Dave] I didn't know you bought all this shit.
translation.zh: ‎我都不知道 你买了这些东西

translation.en: [Dave] Like, yeah, how do you do this?
-This is not a scarf. -[Grace] I have to Google it.
translation.zh:
‎-这不是围巾
‎-我们得搜索一下

translation.en: Go ahead and wrap that around your midsection
Grabbing this end,
and pulling it over the opposite shoulder.
translation.zh: ‎然后把它拉到另一边的肩膀上

translation.en: -You don't want to create... -[Dave] Slow the fuck down.
[chuckles] Okay, wait. So, now we bring it over.
translation.zh: ‎好啦 等等 我帮你弄过来

translation.en: [woman on TV] Gather it up, push it through this tag section,
translation.zh: ‎收拢到一起 穿过标牌的地方

translation.en: make an X on the front, here.
-[Dave] Did I do something wrong? -[Grace] Let me just tie it from the back.
translation.zh: ‎我做错什么了吗？ ‎让我帮你从后面系一下

translation.en: [woman on TV] This one behind this way.
We're gonna just start spreading
all the way across the bend.
[Grace] Okay, so maybe this guy's not for you.
translation.zh: ‎好吧 也许这家伙不适合你

translation.en: I have another one that's better for you.
What do you think?
[Dave] I, for the life of me,
have never quite understood the idea of reincarnation.
translation.zh: ‎我没有特别理解过轮回的概念

translation.en: I think it's a beautiful thing to think about.
translation.zh: ‎我认为这是一件美好的事情

translation.en: -Other way. -[Dave] Maybe it's more of a metaphor.
translation.zh:
‎-反过来
‎-可能更像是一种隐喻

translation.en: You know, I have to be the best version of myself,
you have to be the best version of yourself,
to bestow the best qualities onto our-- our child,
translation.zh: ‎把最好的品质赋予我们的孩子

translation.en: so they can be the best version of themselves, right?
And that's just, like, a continuous link.
Clip that in.
You look like a dad already.
-Someone needs to put me in a Baby Bjorn. -[both laugh]
[Nancy] Congratulations!
-Thank you. -I just--
-I just heard. -[Dave] Yeah.
Well...
it's happening.
[Nancy] When I had my oldest,
it hit me so unexpectedly.
Although I do know about the birds and the bees, by the way.
So I know where she came from.
-[Dave laughs] -However, I was 28.
I was the pastry chef at the recently opened Spago restaurant.
translation.zh: ‎我是刚刚开张的膳朵餐厅的糕点师

translation.en: [Dave] Was there ever a moment, like, "I can't cook anymore."
translation.zh: ‎有没有一瞬间觉得“我当不了厨师了”

translation.en: Nope. There was just never an option.
translation.zh: ‎没有 那是绝对不可能的

translation.en: I knew I was having a baby,
and I knew I was gonna continue doing what I was gonna do.
translation.zh: ‎我也知道 我要继续做一名厨师

translation.en: -And I was gonna make it work. -Man.
I didn't tell Wolfgang that I was pregnant because I was sort of afraid to.
translation.zh: ‎我没有告诉沃尔夫冈 我怀孕了 ‎因为我有点害怕

translation.en: But I told him after about five, six months
translation.zh: ‎但五六个月后 我还是告诉他了

translation.en: that I was pregnant, and his reaction immediately was,
translation.zh: ‎我说我怀孕了 他的反应是

translation.en: "So what? So, you bring the baby to work."
translation.zh: ‎“怎么办？你要带着孩子上班吗？”

translation.en: And that's exactly what I did.
I used to put her in the giant Hobart mixing bowl.
translation.zh: ‎我曾经把她放在巨大的搅拌碗里

translation.en: -[Dave laughs] -[Nancy] In there. And she loved it.
And she couldn't go anywhere. She was safe.
translation.zh: ‎她哪都去不了 挺安全的

translation.en: -It's a perfect... -Exactly, don't forget about that.
translation.zh:
‎-完美！
‎-没错 别忘记这一招

translation.en: When I started La Brea Bakery,
translation.zh: ‎当我创办拉布雷亚面包店时

translation.en: and six months later, opened Campanile,
translation.zh: ‎六个月后 又开了坎帕尼莱

translation.en: I was lucky enough that I lived upstairs from the restaurant.
translation.zh: ‎我很幸运 我就住在餐馆的楼上

translation.en: I would bake from midnight to eight.
translation.zh: ‎我在午夜到早晨这段时间做烘焙

translation.en: I would run upstairs, just covered in flour,
throw together my kids' lunch.
I would then immediately go to sleep for about three or four hours.
translation.zh: ‎然后才去睡觉 ‎大概睡三四个小时

translation.en: I'd wake up around 11, and I would go into the pastry department,
translation.zh: ‎我会在11点左右醒来 走到馅饼区

translation.en: and I would get the cooks set for that day,
make some dessert, show them some new ones,
go back upstairs, take another nap,
translation.zh: ‎然后回到楼上 再睡一觉

translation.en: come back downstairs and plate desserts for the evening.
translation.zh: ‎再下楼来 准备晚上的甜点

translation.en: I'd go back up around ten,
and I would take a two-hour nap,
and down at 12 to work.
And that's what I did.
For close to two years, that schedule.
I was getting, like, stressed out just listening to that. [chuckles]
translation.zh: ‎听你那么说 我都有压力了

translation.en: Like, I've always thought about you as someone that was a mentor/hero
translation.zh: ‎我一直把你当作导师和英雄

translation.en: because of just your culinary endeavors, right?
But now I'm looking at it, like, "Oh, man, she's done this
translation.zh: ‎但现在我会觉得 “天啊 她做到了

translation.en: while raising three kids and growing a business."
translation.zh: ‎养了三个孩子 还事业有成”

translation.en: Like, I don't even understand that.
You gotta step back and you gotta realize,
translation.zh: ‎你必须退后一步 你必须意识到

translation.en: and this might be a silly comparison,
but having a child
is not like creating a recipe.
You don't have that control.
And you gotta do the best you can,
and give all the tools for success.
But in the end,
that kid is gonna grow up, and that kid's gonna be that kid.
translation.zh: ‎孩子会长大 会永远是你的孩子

translation.en: [Dave] What are you feeling, Grace?
[Grace] It's snowing. It's so pretty.
[Dave] You're doing great, babe.
What are you feeling now?
-[quietly] I'm trying to stay calm. -[Dave] You're doing great.
translation.zh: ‎我在努力保持镇静 ‎你做得很好

translation.en: -Thanks. -[Dave sniffling] I can't stop crying.
-I should turn the camera on you. -[Dave chuckles]
[Dave] We'll see you guys soon.
[woman] All right, Dad, you come around, right here.
translation.zh: ‎好了 孩子父亲 过来看看

translation.en: -[Dave] Okay. -[woman] And give me the camera.
[Grace] I'm so proud of Dave.
It's gonna bring a new set of challenges,
but at the same time, it's just been so exciting for us.
translation.zh: ‎与此同时 也会是一件令人开心的事

translation.en: [Edouardo] When I wake up, I get a "Good morning, Daddy."
translation.zh: ‎早晨醒来 儿子会说 “爸爸早上好”

translation.en: That's my stress release.
[Paul] I just had to keep going, no matter what.
translation.zh: ‎无论如何 我都要努力前行

translation.en: Like, literally every day from that point on,
was with my daughter in mind.
[Dave] Feeding your kid,
it's the microcosm of all your beliefs.
It almost brings cooking back to why you cared about it to begin with.
translation.zh: ‎让烹饪这件事回到了最初的初衷

translation.en: I'm here to put all of myself in this
so you can get some nourishment and some love from it.
translation.zh: ‎让你得到营养 得到关爱
